Home > United States > Pennsylvania (PA) > Pocono Mountains Region > Tannersville > Tannersville Restaurants > Gabel's Ice Cream&Fast Food
All 22 Tannersville Restaurants» Gabel's Ice Cream&Fast Food Rte 611 , Tannersville , PA 18372 (570) 629-0370 Got a photo? Add it. Ranked #4 of 22 restaurants in Tannersville 8 Reviews Restaurant details Update restaurant details Write a Review 8 reviews from our community 75% Recommend Excellent 4 Very good 2 Average 2 Poor 0 Terrible 0 Rating summary Food Service Value Atmosphere 8 reviews sorted by Date Rating English first Any mcr195 USA Top Contributor 94 reviews Reviews in 26 cities 15 helpful votes “Support Local Business at a Great Value” Reviewed 29 June 2012 This area is known for brand name shops and way too much advertising. I was pleased to see a Mom and Pop ice cream store. The prices are very good and the food is much fresher than any of the chain junk around. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 6 more reviews by mcr195 for Tannersville Rob M Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania Senior Contributor 47 reviews Reviews in 17 cities 6 helpful votes “Great ice cream. They have food also.” Reviewed 17 June 2012 via mobile I had a cherry icee that was very good. They have other things too such as burgers, etc. Check it out. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? Chris W Tannersville, Pennsylvania Senior Contributor 31 reviews Reviews in 13 cities 1 helpful vote “A Wonderful Place for Ice Cream” Reviewed 16 March 2012 I've been going to Gabel's for over 50 years! It's not a chain...a local piece of history. The current owner has really stepped it up. Good, fast food and good soft and hard ice cream. It's a place you can take the family to and create great memories. We used to get the monster 1 Qt. Chocolate Malt for $0.85... More Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 4 more reviews by Chris W for Tannersville 511GRANDMOO Stroudsburg, Pennsylvania, United States Contributor 15 reviews Reviews in 6 cities 5 helpful votes “YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR !” Reviewed 2 March 2012 Low prices/lousy food. A place for children to play (slides) Quality ice cream is LOW but cheap. (Food -- forget it!) It's a typical drive in and drive out. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 3 more reviews by 511GRANDMOO for Tannersville Jenn G The Poconos Contributor 17 reviews Reviews in 9 cities “Twitch all winter for it to open again.” Reviewed 28 January 2012 via mobile This is a seasonal restaurant opened in the warmer months. People love driving their hotrods here for refreshments on weekend evenings. The food is fresh. Partial to the gyros and hotdogs. The ice cream is yum. There are plenty of options on the menu, but they never overstretch themselves. Food wait can take a couple minutes longer than I would... More Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? See 3 more reviews by Jenn G for Tannersville sunsetdo Senior Reviewer 6 reviews Reviews in 6 cities 3 helpful votes “I have traveled from eastern long island...” Reviewed 15 October 2010 via mobile 1 person found this review helpful I have traveled from eastern long island to tannersville no less than fifty times For vacation and always make a point to stop at gabels.great food,great price, fantastic portions.the ice cream alone is worth the trip. Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? GreenArcherNYC NYC Senior Reviewer 7 reviews Reviews in 6 cities “Great awesome comfort food at a likeable price!” Reviewed 27 March 2009 We're not familiar to the area as it's our first time to be in the Poconos (we're from the city). Driving by Anchor Drive, it's pretty depressing since we're used to a gazillion restaurants lining down main streets. We were sort of wondering where we'd be eating dinner for the night because the food places were so unfamiliar, and as... More Was this review helpful? Yes Problem with this review? A TripAdvisor reviewer on Facebook “They have good, cheap food and great ice cream.” Reviewed 9 July 2008 They have good, cheap food and great ice cream. Was this review helpful?
